docblock.description: Main class for the OpenWeatherMap-PHP-API. Only use this class.

tag.name: var
tag.description: The basic api url to fetch weather data from.

tag.name: var
tag.description: The basic api url to fetch data from.

tag.name: var
tag.description: The basic api url to fetch data from.

docblock.description: Constructs the OpenWeatherMap object.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If set to false, caching is disabled. If this is a valid class extending cmfcmf\OpenWeatherMap\Util\Cache, caching will be enabled. Default false.

tag.name: param
tag.description: How long weather data shall be cached. Default 10 minutes.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: If $cache is neither false nor a valid callable extending cmfcmf\OpenWeatherMap\Util\Cache.

docblock.description: Returns the current weather at the place you specified as an object.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The place to get weather information for. For possible values see below.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Can be either 'metric' or 'imperial' (default). This affects almost all units returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The language to use for descriptions, default is 'en'. For possible values see below.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Your app id, default ''. See http://openweathermap.org/appid for more details.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns a new {@link Weather} object. There are three ways to specify the place to get weather information for: - Use the city name: $query must be a string containing the city name. - Use the city id: $query must be an integer containing the city id. - Use the coordinates: $query must be an associative array containing the 'lat' and 'lon' values. Available languages are (as of 17. July 2013): - English - en - Russian - ru - Italian - it - Spanish - sp - Ukrainian - ua - German - de - Portuguese - pt - Romanian - ro - Polish - pl - Finnish - fi - Dutch - nl - French - fr - Bulgarian - bg - Swedish - se - Chinese Traditional - zh_tw - Chinese Simplified - zh_cn - Turkish - tr

docblock.description: Returns the current weather at the place you specified as an object.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The place to get weather information for. For possible values see below.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Can be either 'metric' or 'imperial' (default). This affects almost all units returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The language to use for descriptions, default is 'en'. For possible values see below.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Your app id, default ''. See http://openweathermap.org/appid for more details.

tag.name: param
tag.description: For how much days you want to get a forecast. Default 1, maximum: 14.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns a new {@link Forecast} object. There are three ways to specify the place to get weather information for: - Use the city name: $query must be a string containing the city name. - Use the city id: $query must be an integer containing the city id. - Use the coordinates: $query must be an associative array containing the 'lat' and 'lon' values. Available languages are (as of 17. July 2013): - English - en - Russian - ru - Italian - it - Spanish - sp - Ukrainian - ua - German - de - Portuguese - pt - Romanian - ro - Polish - pl - Finnish - fi - Dutch - nl - French - fr - Bulgarian - bg - Swedish - se - Chinese Traditional - zh_tw - Chinese Simplified - zh_cn - Turkish - tr

tag.name: deprecated
tag.description: Use {@link self::getRawWeatherData()} instead.

docblock.description: Directly returns the xml/json/html string returned by OpenWeatherMap for the current weather.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The place to get weather information for. For possible values see below.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Can be either 'metric' or 'imperial' (default). This affects almost all units returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The language to use for descriptions, default is 'en'. For possible values see below.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Your app id, default ''. See http://openweathermap.org/appid for more details.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The format of the data fetched. Possible values are 'json', 'html' and 'xml' (default).

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns false on failure and the fetched data in the format you specified on success.

tag.name: warning
tag.description: If an error occured, OpenWeatherMap returns data in json format ALWAYS There are three ways to specify the place to get weather information for: - Use the city name: $query must be a string containing the city name. - Use the city id: $query must be an integer containing the city id. - Use the coordinates: $query must be an associative array containing the 'lat' and 'lon' values. Available languages are (as of 17. July 2013): - English - en - Russian - ru - Italian - it - Spanish - sp - Ukrainian - ua - German - de - Portuguese - pt - Romanian - ro - Polish - pl - Finnish - fi - Dutch - nl - French - fr - Bulgarian - bg - Swedish - se - Chinese Traditional - zh_tw - Chinese Simplified - zh_cn - Turkish - tr

Available languages are (as of 17. July 2013): - English - en - Russian - ru - Italian - it - Spanish - sp - Ukrainian - ua - German - de - Portuguese - pt - Romanian - ro - Polish - pl - Finnish - fi - Dutch - nl - French - fr - Bulgarian - bg - Swedish - se - Chinese Traditional - zh_tw - Chinese Simplified - zh_cn - Turkish - tr

Available languages are (as of 17. docblock.description: Abstract cache class to be overwritten by custom cache implementations.

tag.name: var
tag.description: Cache time in seconds.

docblock.description: Checks whether a cached weather data is available.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The type of the cached data. Can be either 'weather', 'hourlyForecast' or 'dailyForecast'.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The query parameters used.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The units requested.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The language requested.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The mode requested ('xml' or'json').

tag.name: return
tag.description: A \DateTime object containing the time when the weather information was last updated, false if no cached information is available.

tag.name: note
tag.description: This is not the time when the weather was cached, but the {@link Weather::$lastUpdate} value of the cached weather.

tag.name: note
tag.description: You need to check here if a cached result is outdated. Return false in that case.

docblock.description: Returns cached weather data.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The type of the cached data. Can be either 'weather', 'hourlyForecast' or 'dailyForecast'.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The query parameters used.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The units requested.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The language requested.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The mode requested ('xml' or'json').

tag.name: return
tag.description: The cached data if it exists, false otherwise.

docblock.description: Saves cached weather data.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The type of the cached data. Can be either 'weather', 'hourlyForecast' or 'dailyForecast'.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The weather data to cache.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The query parameters used.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The units requested.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The language requested.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The mode requested ('xml' or'json').

tag.name: return
tag.description: True on success, false on failure.

docblock.description: Set after how much seconds the cache shall expire.
